word: We had before us a journey of about one hundred miles, to perform in two days, yet we believed that the Lord would work for us. [LITTLE EDSON WHITE, AFFLICTED WITH CHOLERA AND HEALED IN ANSWER TO PRAYER, ACCOMPANIED HIS PARENTS ON THIS TRIP. AT FIRST IT SEEMED THAT THE CHILD WOULD DIE FROM THE RIGORS OF THE JOURNEY, BUT HIS STRENGTH RETURNED AND HIS MOTHER WROTE: "WE BROUGHT HIM HOME QUITE RUGGED."--LS 145] . . .
